data.title: Here's how tech's most valuable companies have performed under Trump
data.text: Tech's five biggest companies all report earnings this week, giving investors one last look at results before next week's election.

data.title: Tech giants lost more than $270 billion in market value in the last two days
data.text: Big Tech companies lost a collective $273 billion in value over the past two days, as the broader market sank due to a global surge in Covid-19 cases.

data.title: Microsoft Analysts: Q1 Shows Payoff From Cloud Shift, Azure Narrowing The Gap With AWS
data.text: Microsoft reported first-quarter revenue and earnings per share that came in ahead of consensus estimates Tuesday. Azure and the gaming sector were highlights for the Street analysts who cover the tech giant.

data.title: Dow Jones Tumbles 850 Points on Pandemic Fears; Microsoft Stock Sinks After Strong Earnings; Boeing Announces Layoffs
data.text: Revenue and earnings growth for Microsoft wasn't enough to push the stock higher, and Boeing is looking to cut costs further as demand dries up.

data.title: Microsoft announces its first Azure data center region in Taiwan
data.text: After announcing its latest data center region in Austria earlier this month and an expansion of its footprint in Brazil, Microsoft today unveiled its plans to open a new region in Taiwan. This new region will augment its existing presence in East Asia, where the company already runs data centers in China (operated by 21Vianet), Hong […]

data.title: Microsoft (MSFT) Q1 Earnings Top, Azure Drives Top Line
data.text: Microsoft's (MSFT) fiscal first-quarter results benefit from momentum in Azure, impressive Teams user growth led by work-from-home wave and uptake of Surface devices and Xbox Game Pass.

data.title: Breaking down Microsoft's earnings beat, Intel, plus AMD's plans to buy Xilinx for $35 billion
data.text: Daniel Newman, Futurum Research weighs in on Microsoft posting another strong quarter on cloud strength. Also, Newman discusses Intel and AMD's plans to buy Xilinx.

data.title: ETFs to Buy as Cloud Boosts Microsoft's Fiscal Q1 Results
data.text: Microsoft continued to benefit from the work-from-home and learn-at-home trends amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

data.title: Microsoft stock slides on disappointing revenue forecast
data.text: Microsoft's stock price dipped Wednesday after the software giant's revenue forecast for the coming quarter fell short of Wall Street's expectations. The Window's maker's shares tumbled about 3 percent to $206.72 in premarket trading as of 9:07 a.m.

data.title: Microsoft's Shares Falling Despite Earnings Beat Shows It's Time To Take Profits On Tech
data.text: With tech stocks priced to near perfection and macro headwinds building, the risks look increasingly skewed to the downside, so lock in profits and diversify.

data.title: Microsoft's Xbox Could Transform From a Console to a Service
data.text: Could Xbox consoles be replaced by cheap streaming devices that can stream cloud-based games anywhere?

data.title: Microsoft Teams Adds 475% Daily Active Users In About A Year
data.text: Microsoft Corporation's (NASDAQ: MSFT) workplace collaboration software, called "Teams," has 115 million daily active users (DAUs) as of 2021 first quarter's end, CEO Satya Nadella revealed in an earnings call Tuesday, as earlier reported by GeekWire. What Happened: This is a 53.3% growth from April — when Microsoft Teams reported having 75 million DAUs, and 161.3% since March — when the technology giant reported having 44 million DAUs for the service.
